title: wasmCloud Application Deployment Manager (wadm) Manifest
description: Manifest file based on the Open Application Model (OAM) specification for declaratively managing wasmCloud applications

apiVersion.description: The OAM version of the manifest

kind.description: The kind or type of manifest described by the spec

config.description: Named configuration to pass to the provider. The merged set of configuration will be passed to the provider at runtime using the provider SDK's `init()` function.

id.description: The component ID to use for this provider. If not supplied, it will be generated as a combination of the [Metadata::name] and the image reference.

secrets.description: Named secret references to pass to the t. The provider will be able to retrieve these values at runtime using `wasmcloud:secrets/store`.

traits.description: A list of various traits assigned to this component

config.description: Named configuration to pass to the component. The component will be able to retrieve these values at runtime using `wasi:runtime/config.`

id.description: The component ID to use for this component. If not supplied, it will be generated as a combination of the [Metadata::name] and the image reference.

secrets.description: Named secret references to pass to the component. The component will be able to retrieve these values at runtime using `wasmcloud:secrets/store`.

ConfigProperty.description:
Properties for the config list associated with components, providers, and links

## Usage Defining a config block, like so: ```yaml source_config: - name: "external-secret-kv" - name: "default-port" properties: port: "8080" ```

Will result in two config scalers being created, one with the name `basic-kv` and one with the name `default-port`. Wadm will not resolve collisions with configuration names between manifests.

name.description: Name of the config to ensure exists

properties.description: Optional properties to put with the configuration. If the properties are omitted in the manifest, wadm will assume that the configuration is externally managed and will not attempt to create it, only reporting the status as failed if not found.

source.description: Configuration to apply to the source of the link

target.description: Configuration to apply to the target of the link

annotations.description: Optional data for annotating this manifest see <https://github.com/oam-dev/spec/blob/master/metadata.md#annotations-format>

labels.description: Optional data for labeling this manifest, see <https://github.com/oam-dev/spec/blob/master/metadata.md#label-format>

name.description: The name of the manifest. This must be unique per lattice
The name of the secret. This is used by a reference by the component or capability to get the secret value as a resource.

properties.description: The of the secret. This indicates how to retrieve the secret value from a secrets backend and which backend to actually query.

key.description: The key to use for retrieving the secret from the backend.

policy.description: The policy to use for retrieving the secret.

version.description: The version of the secret to retrieve. If not supplied, the latest version will be used.

Specification.description: A representation of an OAM specification

components.description: The list of components for describing an application

policies.description: The list of policies describing an application. This is for providing application-wide setting such as configuration for a secrets backend, how to render Kubernetes services, etc. It can be omitted if no policies are needed for an application.

name.description: The name of this spread requirement

requirements.description: An arbitrary map of labels to match on for scaling requirements

weight.description: An optional weight for this spread. Higher weights are given more precedence

instances.description: Number of instances to spread across matching requirements

name.description: The target this link applies to. This should be the name of a component in the manifest

type.description: The type of trait specified. This should be a unique string for the type of scaler. As we plan on supporting custom scalers, these traits are not enumerated
